body:
When I try to use kubemark to do some perf-tests.I found that some kubemark(hollow-kubelet) will be OOM. Then I kept one kubemark running which I added pprof. 

```
root@k8s-node-perf3-15:/home/log/kubelet98# go tool pprof http://localhost:6060/debug/pprof/heap
Fetching profile from http://localhost:6060/debug/pprof/heap
Saved profile in /root/pprof/pprof.localhost:6060.inuse_objects.inuse_space.006.pb.gz
Entering interactive mode (type "help" for commands)
(pprof) top10
8066.61kB of 8066.61kB total (  100%)
Dropped 392 nodes (cum <= 40.33kB)
Showing top 10 nodes out of 106 (cum >= 512.04kB)
      flat  flat%   sum%        cum   cum%
 2072.09kB 25.69% 25.69%  2072.09kB 25.69%  k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/github.com/beorn7/perks/quantile.NewTargeted
 1184.27kB 14.68% 40.37%  1184.27kB 14.68%  bytes.makeSlice
 1066.16kB 13.22% 53.59%  1066.16kB 13.22%  k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/kubelet/dockertools.(*FakeDockerClient).ListContainers
  650.62kB  8.07% 61.65%   650.62kB  8.07%  k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/github.com/golang/glog.(*syncBuffer).rotateFile
  524.09kB  6.50% 68.15%   524.09kB  6.50%  k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/runtime.(*Scheme).AddKnownTypes
  516.01kB  6.40% 74.54%   516.01kB  6.40%  k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/github.com/prometheus/client_golang/prometheus.newDefaultRegistry
     515kB  6.38% 80.93%      515kB  6.38%  reflect.Value.call
     514kB  6.37% 87.30%  2586.09kB 32.06%  k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/github.com/prometheus/client_golang/prometheus.newSummary
  512.31kB  6.35% 93.65%   512.31kB  6.35%  net/http.(*Transport).tryPutIdleConn
  512.04kB  6.35%   100%   512.04kB  6.35%  net/http.(*persistConn).roundTrip
```

We found that `(*FakeDockerClient).ListContainers` use 1066.16kB and the number of `flat` in it is inscreasing. I add some log in this function:

```
var calltime = 0
// ListContainers is a test-spy implementation of DockerInterface.ListContainers.
// It adds an entry "list" to the internal method call record.
func (f *FakeDockerClient) ListContainers(options dockertypes.ContainerListOptions) ([]dockertypes.Container, error) {
	f.Lock()
	defer f.Unlock()
	f.called = append(f.called, calledDetail{name: "list"})
	err := f.popError("list")
	containerList := append([]dockertypes.Container{}, f.RunningContainerList...)
	if options.All {
		// Although the container is not sorted, but the container with the same name should be in order,
		// that is enough for us now.
		// TODO(random-liu): Is a fully sorted array needed?
		containerList = append(containerList, f.ExitedContainerList...)
	}
	calltime++
	glog.Warningf("[HY] f.called: len: %d, size: %d ; cont len: %d, size: %d ; calltime: %d", len(f.called), reflect.TypeOf(f.called).Size(), len(containerList), reflect.TypeOf(containerList).Size(), calltime)
	return containerList, err
}
```
and found that log:
```
2017-01-11 14:27:32.558310 W fake_docker_client.go:273] [HY] f.called: len: 20486, size: 24 ; cont len: 0, size: 24 ; calltime: 19544
2017-01-11 14:27:33.314934 W fake_docker_client.go:273] [HY] f.called: len: 20487, size: 24 ; cont len: 0, size: 24 ; calltime: 19545
2017-01-11 14:27:34.315221 W fake_docker_client.go:273] [HY] f.called: len: 20488, size: 24 ; cont len: 0, size: 24 ; calltime: 19546
```
We saw that the array  `f.called`  won't be released. It is used to record operation of fakedockerclient and only be check in unit test.

I think it be removed or periodically cleaned.

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Node.
labels.name: sig/node

title: BUG REPORT: FakeDockerClient will caused memory leak
